subject: Using parallel computer in JUnit 4.6
msgSnippet: I m reviewing the experimental functionality of running parallel tests at the class level; i.e. Parallel.classes(), I notice in the ParallelComputer class,
messageBody: I'm reviewing the experimental functionality of running parallel tests at the class level; i.e. Parallel.classes(), I notice in the ParallelComputer class, run() method there is a call get with a timeout for 2000 milliseconds. Is there a significant reason for this versus get() without any timeout? In conducting test without JUnit test cases, I'm finding this timeout feature creates timeout exceptions whereas running JUnit without the timeout allows my test to run successfully. Can anyone explain why this timeout is needed?
